import Mathlib

open Filter

variable {x lam : â„• â†’ â„}

open Finset

/-
We assert: if the partial sums of x are bounded, lam_n â†’ 0, and
âˆ‘ |lam_{n+1}-lam_n| is summable, then âˆ‘ lam_n * x_n is summable.
-/

theorem jirilebl_ra_ch_seq_ser_4414
  (h_bound : âˆƒ C : â„, âˆ€ n : â„•, abs (Finset.sum (Finset.range (n+1)) (fun i => x i)) â‰¤ C)
  (h_lam : Filter.Tendsto lam Filter.atTop (ð“ (0 : â„)))
  (h_diff : Summable fun n => abs (lam (n+1) - lam n)) :
  Summable fun n => lam n * x n := by
  sorry

import Mathlib

open Filter
open Finset

variable {x lam : â„• â†’ â„}

/-- If the partial sums of x are bounded, lam_n â†’ 0, and
    âˆ‘ |lam_{n+1}-lam_n| is summable, then âˆ‘ lam_n * x_n is summable. -/
theorem jirilebl_ra_ch_seq_ser_4414
  (h_bound : âˆƒ C : â„, âˆ€ n : â„•, abs (Finset.sum (Finset.range (n+1)) (fun i => x i)) â‰¤ C)
  (h_lam : Filter.Tendsto lam Filter.atTop (nhds (0 : â„)))
  (h_diff : Summable fun n => abs (lam (n+1) - lam n)) :
  Summable fun n => lam n * x n := by
  sorry
